'fixed_ips': [{ 'subnet_id': 'external_subnet_id', 'ip_address': "1.2.3.4" }], 'device_id': self.router_id } if expected_result is None: if interface_type == "internal": expected_result = [internal_port] elif interface_type == "external": expected_result = [external_port] else: expected_result = [internal_port, external_port] self.register_uris([ dict(method='GET', uri=self.get_mock_url( 'network', 'public', append=['v2.0', 'ports.json'], qs_elements=["device_id=%s" % self.router_id]), json={'ports': [internal_port, external_port]}) ]) ret = self.cloud.list_router_interfaces(router, interface_type) self.assertEqual(expected_result, ret) self.assert_calls() def test_list_router_interfaces_no_gw(self): router = { 'id': self.router_id } self._test_list_router_interfaces(router, interface_type="external", expected_result=[]) def test_list_router_interfaces_gw_none(self): """ If a router does have external_gateway_info set to None, do not fail. """ router = { 'id': self.router_id, 'external_gateway_info': None } self._test_list_router_interfaces(router, interface_type="external", expected_result=[]) def test_list_router_interfaces_all(self): router = { 'id': self.router_id, 'external_gateway_info': { 'external_fixed_ips': [{ 'subnet_id': 'external_subnet_id', 'ip_address': '1.2.3.4'}] } } self._test_list_router_interfaces(router, interface_type=None) def test_list_router_interfaces_internal(self): router = { 'id': self.router_id, 'external_gateway_info': { 'external_fixed_ips': [{ 'subnet_id': 'external_subnet_id', 'ip_address': '1.2.3.4'}] } } self._test_list_router_interfaces(router, interface_type="internal") def test_list_router_interfaces_external(self): router = { 'id': self.router_id, 'external_gateway_info': { 'external_fixed_ips': [{ 'subnet_id': 'external_subnet_id', 'ip_address': '1.2.3.4'}] } } self._test_list_router_interfaces(router, interface_type="external")

commit_message:
Use requests-mock for the volume backup tests

Change-Id: I88d7351a2fc147224542898d08e2a769a62577a0
Signed-off-by: Rosario Di Somma <rosario.disomma@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/98/459898/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from shade import metaclass TestVolumeBackups(base.RequestsMockTestCase): def _get_normalized_dict_from_object(self, backup): self.cloud._remove_novaclient_artifacts(backup) return meta.obj_to_dict(backup) def test_search_volume_backups(self): name = 'Volume1' vol1 = {'name': name, 'availability_zone': 'az1'} vol2 = {'name': name, 'availability_zone': 'az1'} vol3 = {'name': 'Volume2', 'availability_zone': 'az2'} self.register_uris([ dict(method='GET', uri=self.get_mock_url( 'volumev2', 'public', append=['backups', 'detail']), json={"backups": [vol1, vol2, vol3]})]) name, {'availability_zone': 'az1'}) result = [self._get_normalized_dict_from_object(i) for i in result] self.assertEqual(len(result), 2) self.assertEqual([vol1, vol2], result) self.assert_calls() def test_get_volume_backup(self): name = 'Volume1' vol1 = {'name': name, 'availability_zone': 'az1'} vol2 = {'name': name, 'availability_zone': 'az2'} vol3 = {'name': 'Volume2', 'availability_zone': 'az1'} self.register_uris([ dict(method='GET', uri=self.get_mock_url( 'volumev2', 'public', append=['backups', 'detail']), json={"backups": [vol1, vol2, vol3]})]) name, {'availability_zone': 'az1'}) result = self._get_normalized_dict_from_object(result) self.assertEqual(vol1, result) self.assert_calls() def test_list_volume_backups(self): backup = {'id': '6ff16bdf-44d5-4bf9-b0f3-687549c76414', 'status': 'available'} search_opts = {'status': 'available'} self.register_uris([ dict(method='GET', uri=self.get_mock_url( 'volumev2', 'public', append=['backups', 'detail'], qs_elements=['='.join(i) for i in search_opts.items()]), json={"backups": [backup]})]) result = self.cloud.list_volume_backups(True, search_opts) result = [self._get_normalized_dict_from_object(i) for i in result] self.assertEqual(len(result), 1) self.assertEqual([backup], result) self.assert_calls() def test_delete_volume_backup_wait(self): backup = {'id': backup_id} self.register_uris([ dict(method='GET', uri=self.get_mock_url( 'volumev2', 'public', append=['backups', 'detail']), json={"backups": [backup]}), dict(method='DELETE', uri=self.get_mock_url( 'volumev2', 'public', append=['backups', backup_id])), dict(method='GET', uri=self.get_mock_url( 'volumev2', 'public', append=['backups', 'detail']), json={"backups": [backup]}), dict(method='GET', uri=self.get_mock_url( 'volumev2', 'public', append=['backups', 'detail']), json={"backups": []})]) self.cloud.delete_volume_backup(backup_id, False, True, 1) self.assert_calls() def test_delete_volume_backup_force(self): backup_id = '6ff16bdf-44d5-4bf9-b0f3-687549c76414' backup = {'id': backup_id} self.register_uris([ dict(method='GET', uri=self.get_mock_url( 'volumev2', 'public', append=['backups', 'detail']), json={"backups": [backup]}), dict(method='POST', uri=self.get_mock_url( 'volumev2', 'public', append=['backups', backup_id, 'action']), json={'os-force_delete': {}}, validate=dict(json={u'os-force_delete': None})), commit_message:
test-prepare-hosts.yml: Do not hardcode path for iptables executable

iptables may not always be installed in /sbin so determine the path
during runtime.

Change-Id: I64fb235269ea66d76e2e8c3f42a6c78a9bbe99d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/84/459984/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Determine iptables path shell: which iptables register: _iptables_path command: "{{ _iptables_path.stdout }} -A POSTROUTING -t mangle -p tcp -j CHECKSUM --checksum-fill" command: "{{ _iptables_path.stdout }} -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o eth0 -j MASQUERADE"
deleted_lines: command: /sbin/iptables -A POSTROUTING -t mangle -p tcp -j CHECKSUM --checksum-fill command: /sbin/iptables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o eth0 -j MASQUERADE

update the cache properly if the cache update and the

commit_message:
Optimise apt cache update task

The update of the apt cache and the package installation
can all be handled in a single task by providing the
package action plugin with the right parameters. This
removes an extra task to optimise execution.

The minimum Ansible version is raised to 2.2 due to a
known bug [1] in Ansible's apt module which does not
update the cache properly if the cache update and the
install are combined in a single task.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/1497

Change-Id: I165479e62e921adb2a46fcbdb3b7c0118b2ef739
(cherry picked from commit 9a11687bd0da5a44b9d22bdeaa20dcf38663c58f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_server refs/changes/27/460027/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Define a new function for notifications URL

This defines a new function get_notification_url, which returns the URL
of RabbitMQ when you want connect to it, and uses in
ceilometermiddleware. This fixes an issue when we try to use AMQP for
RPC, but not for notifications.

Change-Id: I14450b2440806a17a90e5ddefc243868fdbe4f2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/94/456594/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Repeat the defition, in case get_transport_url is overriden for RPC purpose. # get_notification_url can then be used to talk to rabbit for notifications. function get_notification_url { local virtual_host=$1 if is_service_enabled rabbit || { [ -n "$RABBIT_HOST" ] && [ -n "$RABBIT_PASSWORD" ]; }; then echo "rabbit://$RABBIT_USERID:$RABBIT_PASSWORD@$RABBIT_HOST:5672/$virtual_host" fi }

commit_message:
bindep.txt: Fix package name for ndg-httpsclient

Commit 15ed2ec42ce5 ("bindep.txt: Use RedHat and SUSE platforms in
bindep.txt") added support for the new 'redhat' and 'suse' families
in bindep. However, this broke the SUSE case because the ndg-httpsclient
package name is different between RedHat and SUSE so we need to use
separate packages for these families.

Fixes: Commit 15ed2ec42ce5 ("bindep.txt: Use RedHat and SUSE platforms in bindep.txt")
Change-Id: I36919b56b01a32ca8014377181fe9907fd901ea7

commit_message:
[upstream] Update workflow setup slides to show tox

The slides that demonstrated how to run unit test
in the workflow setup and first patch slides used
run_tests.sh .  At this point most, if not all, projects
have moved to using tox instead.

This patch changes the example output to show how to use
tox instead or run_tests.sh.

Change-Id: If55633f44a6ea47ae1c04ae0d46b096295e15cd9

Small workaround for parent being an attribute rather than a

commit_message:
Handle crash on psutils 1.x environment

Small workaround for parent being an attribute rather than a
method in psutils 1.x. I didn't add it to the compat layer
because its the single place of use, but we could reconsider
that if needed.

Change-Id: I740abba9fe3d47186020f0a3c1ad0007e7c28fc9

added_lines: heat_template_version: ocata description: Collectd client service parameters: ServiceNetMap: default: {} description: Mapping of service_name -> network name. Typically set via parameter_defaults in the resource registry. This mapping overrides those in ServiceNetMapDefaults. type: json EndpointMap: default: {} description: Mapping of service endpoint -> protocol. Typically set via parameter_defaults in the resource registry. type: json DefaultPasswords: default: {} type: json CollectdDefaultPlugins: default: - disk - interface - load - memory - processes - tcpconns type: comma_delimited_list description: > List of collectd plugins to activate on all overcloud hosts. See the documentation for the puppet-collectd module for a list plugins supported by the module (https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-collectd). Set this key to override the default list of plugins. Use CollectdExtraPlugins if you want to load additional plugins without overriding the defaults. CollectdExtraPlugins: default: [] type: comma_delimited_list description: > List of collectd plugins to activate on all overcloud hosts. See the documentation for the puppet-collectd module for a list plugins supported by the module (https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-collectd). Set this key to load plugins in addition to those in CollectdDefaultPlugins. CollectdServer: type: string description: > Address of remote collectd server to which we will send metrics. default: '' CollectdServerPort: type: number default: 25826 description: > Port on remote collectd server to which we will send metrics. CollectdUsername: type: string description: > Username for authenticating to the remote collectd server. The default is to not configure any authentication. default: '' CollectdPassword: type: string hidden: true description: > Password for authenticating to the remote collectd server. The default is to not configure any authentication. default: '' CollectdSecurityLevel: type: string description: > Security level setting for remote collectd connection. If it is set to Sign or Encrypt the CollectdPassword and CollectdUsername parameters need to be set. default: 'None' constraints: - allowed_values: - None - Sign - Encrypt outputs: role_data: description: Role data for the Collectd client role. value: service_name: collectd config_settings: collectd::manage_repo: false collectd::purge: true collectd::recurse: true collectd::purge_config: true collectd::minimum_version: "5.7" tripleo::profile::base::metrics::collectd::collectd_server: get_param: CollectdServer tripleo::profile::base::metrics::collectd::collectd_port: get_param: CollectdServerPort tripleo::profile::base::metrics::collectd::collectd_username: get_param: CollectdUsername tripleo::profile::base::metrics::collectd::collectd_password: get_param: CollectdPassword tripleo::profile::base::metrics::collectd::collectd_securitylevel: get_param: CollectdSecurityLevel tripleo.collectd.plugins.collectd: yaql: data: default_plugins: {get_param: CollectdDefaultPlugins} extra_plugins: {get_param: CollectdExtraPlugins} expression: > ($.data.default_plugins + $.data.extra_plugins) .flatten().distinct() step_config: | include ::tripleo::profile::base::metrics::collectd upgrade_tasks: - name: Check status of collectd service shell: > /usr/bin/systemctl show collectd --property ActiveState | grep '\bactive\b' tags: step0,validation - name: Stop collectd service tags: step1 service: name=collectd state=stopped

commit_message:
2.44: Deprecate multinic, add/remove_floatingip, virtual_interfaces

The multinic, add/remove_floatingip and virtual_interfaces API are
deprecated in change:

I1848db384a825d3b166f113b30ebad92113af8e5

This patch deprecates the related API binding and shell commands.

Implements blueprint deprecate-multinic-proxy-api

Change-Id: I978e6a043d5b2837228543de1d084a3c0439994d

commit_message:
Don't remove model_query_hooks during tests

Revert the change introduced in tests/base.py by
Ib6c2134d29e1764de627c3355f6cdee789d6301e

This change breaks UTs of net-bgpvpn that rely on query hooks.

Change-Id: I3bf512c3d714c16623558f35fad5b5dff1d8ed25

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 20:10:41.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/v1/shell.py', 'troveclient/v1/instances.py', 'troveclient/v1/clusters.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient/commit/29493eb37d5fb4b78501b5ecd201bee2b31ae1f2', 'message': 'Restrict reset-status command to admin

The reset status command should only be used by an Admin as
resetting the state of an instance/cluster can be dangerous.
Any user should still be able to force delete an instance/cluster.

Since, force delete calls the reset status command and then the
delete command it is necessary to pass a flag indicating that
the reset status is being performed for a force delete and the
policy should allow it. If reset status command is being called
for a force delete the body will be appended to indicate it.

Change-Id: Ide36a3ae3e5e8596737227c43f1229b887aba524
'}]
commit_message:
Restrict reset-status command to admin

The reset status command should only be used by an Admin as
resetting the state of an instance/cluster can be dangerous.
Any user should still be able to force delete an instance/cluster.

Since, force delete calls the reset status command and then the
delete command it is necessary to pass a flag indicating that
the reset status is being performed for a force delete and the
policy should allow it. If reset status command is being called
for a force delete the body will be appended to indicate it.

Change-Id: Ide36a3ae3e5e8596737227c43f1229b887aba524
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/58/420158/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.manager.reset_status(self, force_delete=True) def reset_status(self, cluster, force_delete=False): :param force_delete: Flag to indicate force delete operation if force_delete: body = {'reset-status': 'force_delete'} else: body = {'reset-status': {}}

commit_message:
Use mock in instances_actions.py

Replace mox with mock in test.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/remove-mox-ocata

Change-Id: Ic23c87170cfe832fe5303b19ee9e269df5466deb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/24/409724/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mock self.server = mock.Mock(spec=Server) with mock.patch.object(MgmtInstance, 'load') as mock_load: mock_load.return_value = self.instance req, body = self._make_request(context=self.context) self.controller = MgmtInstanceController() resp = self.controller.action(req, body, self.tenant_id, self.db_info.id) mock_load.assert_called_once_with(context=self.context, id=self.db_info.id) return resp
deleted_lines: from mox3 import mox self.mock = mox.Mox() self.server = self.mock.CreateMock(Server) self.mock.StubOutWithMock(MgmtInstance, 'load') MgmtInstance.load(context=self.context, id=self.db_info.id).AndReturn(self.instance) self.mock.ReplayAll() req, body = self._make_request(context=self.context) self.controller = MgmtInstanceController() resp = self.controller.action(req, body, self.tenant_id, self.db_info.id) self.mock.UnsetStubs() self.mock.VerifyAll() return resp

commit_message:
Refactor a test method including 3 test cases

The test_swap_volume_volume_api_usage method
in test_compute_mgr.py has 3 test cases (1 normal, 2 errors).
So devide it to the following 3 test methods.

* test_swap_volume_volume_api_usage
* test_swap_volume_with_compute_driver_exception
* test_swap_volume_with_initialize_connection_exception

Change-Id: I08278c10104786a12835ab64a3602503901285bc

commit_message:
[Negative] Create a volume from deactivated image

This test validates that creating a volume from a deactivated image
is not possible.

Change-Id: Id243918cd895af9b8548c928cad32914dc84942d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/52/459252/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.common import waiters from tempest import configfrom tempest.lib.common.utils import test_utilsCONF = config.CONF def setup_clients(cls): super(VolumesNegativeTest, cls).setup_clients() if CONF.service_available.glance: if CONF.image_feature_enabled.api_v2: cls.image_client = cls.os.image_client_v2 else: raise lib_exc.InvalidConfiguration( 'api_v2 must be True in [image-feature-enabled].') @classmethod @decorators.attr(type=['negative']) @decorators.idempotent_id('d15e7f35-2cfc-48c8-9418-c8223a89bcbb') @test.services('image') def test_create_volume_from_deactivated_image(self): # Upload volume to image image_name = data_utils.rand_name(self.__class__.__name__ + '-Image') image = self.volumes_client.upload_volume( self.volume['id'], image_name=image_name, disk_format=CONF.volume.disk_format)['os-volume_upload_image'] self.addCleanup(test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, self.image_client.delete_image, image['image_id']) waiters.wait_for_image_status(self.image_client, image['image_id'], 'active') waiters.wait_for_volume_resource_status(self.volumes_client, self.volume['id'], 'available') # Deactivate the image self.image_client.deactivate_image(image['image_id']) body = self.image_client.show_image(image['image_id']) self.assertEqual("deactivated", body['status']) # Try creating a volume from deactivated image self.assertRaises(lib_exc.BadRequest, self.create_volume, imageRef=image['image_id'])

commit_message:
Grafana: automatically set InfuxDB datasource

In order to automate Grafana configuration, this fix automatically
set the InfluxDB datasource. This avoid doing a annoying manual
configuration after Kolla-ansible deployment.

Change-Id: I2b1a63fd371966192f1df0a82cee4711c6324710
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/94/457094/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-11 16:09:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/3bef70270b293b01619cc36aebefeb77a6b26ff8', 'message': "we now need to have dib installed explicitly

dib is now going to have to be installed explicitly for us to actually
run the gate. the old method of just cloning the repo won't work with
dib v2.

There are other ways to accomplish this but I'm choosing this approach
knowing that it isn't ideal. First, what's the downside? This means
that dib gets installed wherever trove control plane is installed. Is
that necessary, NO. Is it the end of the world, NO.

What are the options?

- do what Octavia did and have a second requirements.txt in a folder
  called diskimage-create. Would this work, yes but we don't have such
  a mechanism right now and nothing would keep this requirements.txt
  file in sync with g-r that I know of.

- hardcode the pip install command somewhere in the devstack
  plugin. yes, this would work but this would also have no ability to
  sync with g-r.

So, while the solution proposed here isn't ideal, it strikes me as not
bad, and much less risk than the other two options.

We also need to figure out where the elements are and fix the path for
disk-image-create.

Some pep8 failures appears to have crept in as well, those are
addressed.

Change-Id: Ic64d91e082102057417995a0f6851d03b9e0ca74

commit_message:
we now need to have dib installed explicitly

dib is now going to have to be installed explicitly for us to actually
run the gate. the old method of just cloning the repo won't work with
dib v2.

There are other ways to accomplish this but I'm choosing this approach
knowing that it isn't ideal. First, what's the downside? This means
that dib gets installed wherever trove control plane is installed. Is
that necessary, NO. Is it the end of the world, NO.

What are the options?

- do what Octavia did and have a second requirements.txt in a folder
  called diskimage-create. Would this work, yes but we don't have such
  a mechanism right now and nothing would keep this requirements.txt
  file in sync with g-r that I know of.

- hardcode the pip install command somewhere in the devstack
  plugin. yes, this would work but this would also have no ability to
  sync with g-r.

So, while the solution proposed here isn't ideal, it strikes me as not
bad, and much less risk than the other two options.

We also need to figure out where the elements are and fix the path for
disk-image-create.

Some pep8 failures appears to have crept in as well, those are
addressed.

Change-Id: Ic64d91e082102057417995a0f6851d03b9e0ca74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/68/455768/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Allow CONTENT_LENGTH to be present but empty
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-11 13:30:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/17ea9f11d5ff87345e63d975b0ed251665a324a6', 'message': "Don't force CONTENT_LENGTH to be an int()

The CONTENT_LENGTH Header can be present, but empty, which returns as None and
causes a ValueError when attempting to use .int().

This patch removes the setting of CONTENT_LENGTH to an integer, since it
doesn't need to be an int, and on integer comparisons are performed
afterwards.

Change-Id: I66b6f9afbea8bf037997a59ba0b976f83c9825fb
Closes-Bug: #1681843
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-11 13:49:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7845491b45bb4d7f8b7d912e1abd9d7a10745573', 'message': "Don't force CONTENT_LENGTH to be an int()

The CONTENT_LENGTH Header can be present, but empty, which returns None,
and causes a ValueError when attempting to use .int().

This patch removes the setting of CONTENT_LENGTH to an integer, since it
doesn't need to be an int, and on integer comparisons are performed
afterwards.

Additionally, as the CONTENT_TYPE header can similarly be present but
empty, we should .get() it in a similar fashion to ensure it isn't
present but None.

Change-Id: I66b6f9afbea8bf037997a59ba0b976f83c9825fb
Closes-Bug: #1681843
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-11 14:23:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c2b520c293ce0caa6d739ba59152da72b21e7198', 'message': 'Don't force CONTENT_LENGTH to be an int()

The CONTENT_LENGTH Header can be present, but empty, which returns None,
and causes a ValueError when attempting to use .int().

This patch removes the setting of CONTENT_LENGTH to an integer, but
instead ensures that if CONTENT_LENGTH is not empty it is an integer, to
prevent a situation where a bogus "CONTENT_LENGTH" header is specified.

Additionally, as the CONTENT_TYPE header can similarly be present but
empty, we should .get() it in a similar fashion to ensure it isn't
present but None when CONTENT_LENGTH is specified.

Change-Id: I66b6f9afbea8bf037997a59ba0b976f83c9825fb
Closes-Bug: #1681843
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-04-11 14:25:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6ad7c3670b0a43be2c7f1926175ebeaa3367c518', 'message': 'Allow CONTENT_LENGTH to be present but empty

This patch removes the setting of CONTENT_LENGTH to an integer, but
instead ensures that if CONTENT_LENGTH is not empty it is an integer, to
prevent a situation where a bogus "CONTENT_LENGTH" header is specified.

Additionally, as the CONTENT_TYPE environ can similarly be present but
empty, we should .get() it in a similar fashion to ensure it isn't
present but None when CONTENT_LENGTH is specified.

Change-Id: I66b6f9afbea8bf037997a59ba0b976f83c9825fb
Closes-Bug: #1681843

commit_message:
Allow CONTENT_LENGTH to be present but empty

The CONTENT_LENGTH environ can be present, but empty, which returns
None, and causes a ValueError when attempting to use .int().

This patch removes the setting of CONTENT_LENGTH to an integer, but
instead ensures that if CONTENT_LENGTH is not empty it is an integer, to
prevent a situation where a bogus "CONTENT_LENGTH" header is specified.

Additionally, as the CONTENT_TYPE environ can similarly be present but
empty, we should .get() it in a similar fashion to ensure it isn't
present but None when CONTENT_LENGTH is specified.

Change-Id: I66b6f9afbea8bf037997a59ba0b976f83c9825fb
Closes-Bug: #1681843
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/455710/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if environ.get('CONTENT_LENGTH', 0):

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-23 20:28:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/0a3c19e75a5a3ccedc8efd1510ebc404e47ff6f0', 'message': 'WIP use composite ring metadata to prevent bad things

This is a WIP to test out some ideas for using composite ring
metadata to check that consistent component rings are used when
updating a composite ring.

This patch breaks out the ring composition function into more
granular functions to give callers a choice of how to use the
composite_builder module, so that we can experiment/iterate on
how programmatic and CLI users might manage rings and metadata.

With this patch we have functions for:
- checking component builders for consistency among themselves
- checking component builder lists for consistency with existing
  composite ring when updating a composition - for now these
  checks prohibit anything other than updating an existing
  composite using the same list of builders in same order (KISS)
- getting a composite RingData object
- getting composite ring metadata
- getting composite RingData with the metadata embedded
- updating (or creating) and writing a composite ring.gz

Open questions:
- the exact content of composite ring metadata - in particular,
  what attributes of a builder are stored in composite metadata,
  and which of them are used to establish the equality of component
  builders. For now that is a md5 hash but I am not keen on that.
- what operations we want to support on an existing composite ring?
  For now it is only to re-compose using same list of builders.
- where should composite ring metadata be stored? For now it is
  written to the ring.gz file

Change-Id: I06f226c84d34ad5f5402fd2f056ffd765f939a48
Related-Change: I0d8928b55020592f8e75321d1f7678688301d797

Open questions:

commit_message:
Add id to RingBuilder to differentiate rings in composite

A RingBuilder now gets a UUID when it is saved to file if
it does not already have one.

RingBuilders loaded from file do NOT get a UUID assigned unless
it was persisted in the file. This forces users to explicitly
assign an id to existing ring builders by saving the state back
to file.

The UUID is used to check that components of a composite ring
are consistent.

The UUID is included in first line of the output from:

  swift-ring-builder <builder-file>

Change-Id: I06f226c84d34ad5f5402fd2f056ffd765f939a48
Related-Change: I0d8928b55020592f8e75321d1f7678688301d797

commit_message:
Add documentation for Linux Bridge plugin

Change-Id: I66943e95de66da8b10d04e86f596167798efde15
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-vif refs/changes/91/459291/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============ Linux Bridge ============ The Linux Bridge plugin, ``vif_plug_linux_bridge``, is an `os-vif` VIF plugin for the Linux Bridge network backend. It is one of two plugins provided as part of `os-vif` itself, the other being :doc:`ovs`. Supported VIF Types =================== The Linux Bridge plugin provides support for the following VIF types: `VIFBridge` Configuration where a guest is connected to a Linux bridge via a TAP device. This is the only supported configuration for this plugin. For information on the VIF type objects, refer to :doc:`../vif_types`. Note that only the above VIF types are supported by this plugin.

Add documentation for OVS plugin

Change-Id: I741d2f9dae18e0d294f87bea52b5638430eb30ce
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-vif refs/changes/58/459258/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============= VIF Plug OVS ============= VIF Plug OVS is An `os-vif` VIF plugin for plugging and unplugging virtual interfaces that use OpenVSwitch. There are several VIF types which can be plugged to the OpenVSwitch. Each VIF Type has it own plug/unplug method. Supported VIF Types ------------------- * `VIFOpenVSwitch` - configuration were a guest connected an OpenVSwitch bridge. * `VIFBridge` - configuration were a guest connected to a Linux bridge and the bridge connected to the OpenVSwitch bridge. The Linux bridge use to house iptables rules for the virtual machine traffic. * `VIFVHostUser` - configuration were a guest expose a UNIX socket for its control plane. This configuration allows to work with OpenVSwitch-DPDK

When you execute nova-manage commands, oslo logs to the following
file.

    /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log

Because puppet-nova is executing these commands as root,
nova-manage.log is owned by root:root, preventing the 'nova-manage
db archive_deleted_rows' entry in nova's crontab from executing.

    Permission denied: '/var/log/nova/nova-manage.log'

This log file is also an outlier, as all other log files in
/var/log/nova/ are owned by nova:nova.

A follow-up patch will need to chown this log file for the upgrade
case. It might also make sense to just explicitly touch this file
etc in the install case too since this bug keeps coming back.

commit_message:
Run nova-manage commands as the nova user

When you execute nova-manage commands, oslo logs to the following
location (file name is dynamically created based on command name).

    /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log

Because puppet-nova is executing these commands as root,
nova-manage.log is owned by root:root, preventing the 'nova-manage
db archive_deleted_rows' entry in nova's crontab from executing.

    Permission denied: '/var/log/nova/nova-manage.log'

This log file is also an outlier, as all other log files in
/var/log/nova/ are owned by nova:nova.

Follow-up patches will need to chown this log file for the upgrade
case. It might also make sense to just explicitly touch this file
in the install case too since this bug keeps coming back (here are
a few of them).

    https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-nova/+bug/1671681
    https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1044155
    https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1289761
    https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1368588
    https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1428572

Change-Id: I428d1a721aa11542318dca4fa25fd167e54ebc35

commit_message:
Switch to use test_utils.call_until_true

test.call_until_true has been deprecated since Newton on Tempest side,
and now Tempest provides test_utils.call_until_true as the stable
library method. So this patch switches to use the stable method before
removing old test.call_until_true on Tempest side.

Change-Id: Ie1ecf45962dafb8b46f1bd138a2d44521c8eff67
(cherry picked from commit d959f5f2ddb6a4aab2cf1084210ae2e58e6ceab3)

commit_message:
Remove nova-networks

Nova-networks is deprecated now. So we should remove nova-networks
from Rally-0.10.0.

Refs:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/deprecate-nova-network

Change-Id: I2ce73bd88c8821682745ca34189c2875b631d90f

commit_message:
Add upgrade_batch_tasks to neutron-l3-agent for tenant floating IP

This stops l3-agent, updates openstack-neutron and then starts the agent
again, using upgrade_batch_tasks so will happen on one node at a time.
Goal is for the floating IPs to failover to another l3 agent.

Note: there is an unresolved packaging bug in openvswitch
neutron-openvswitch-agent discussed in the bug below which will still
cause floating IP downtime (see comment #2)

Related-Bug: 1671504
Change-Id: Ic8cb74e0526a223b2bfb868abcb008be13586af9

Looks at some issues rendering the longer descriptions that are included
in agents, lock_server and security_groups. Because the lines are too
long in our description, then end up getting wrapped strangely in the

commit_message:
Fix rendering of several policy rule descriptions

Looks at some issues rendering the longer descriptions that are included
in agents, lock_server and security_groups. Because the lines are too
long in our description, then end up getting wrapped strangely in the
rendered sample file. Avoid this by using line continuations for all the
long lines, leaving the other line breaks to render as expected.

blueprint policy-docs

Change-Id: I521da92f217ac8eb894ee72b3394d18bb1c8fc1f

subject: Optimise apt cache update task
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-21 15:48:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift/commit/ad0de43caec806f42efd816bd0cb2360a9cfc597', 'message': "Optimise apt cache update task

The update of the apt cache and the package installation
can all be handled in a single task by providing the
package action plugin with the right parameters. This
removes an extra task to optimise execution.

The minimum Ansible version is raised to 2.2 due to a
known bug [1] in Ansible's apt module which does not
update the cache properly if the cache update and the
install are combined in a single task.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/1497

Change-Id: I532d866286d4cb885e1f3696819455cbdc8c0c39

commit_message:
Optimise apt cache update task

The update of the apt cache and the package installation
can all be handled in a single task by providing the
package action plugin with the right parameters. This
removes an extra task to optimise execution.

The minimum Ansible version is raised to 2.2 due to a
known bug [1] in Ansible's apt module which does not
update the cache properly if the cache update and the
install are combined in a single task.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/1497

Change-Id: I532d866286d4cb885e1f3696819455cbdc8c0c39

commit_message:
Fix bugs about 'default' domain.

When default_domain_id configured is not 'default', it will
throw erros.
So use CONF.identity.default_domain_id instead of 'default'.

Change-Id: Idca1a4c70242ed8f72b01b9e5de7a3de47627a76
Closes-Bug: 1682984

commit_message:
NetApp: Refresh directory before waiting

After image cloning the NFS client cache needs to be refreshed.
This can be accomplished by touching the directory hosting the
cached image file.

See also: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1617299
Co-Authored-By: Sebastian Schee <sebastian.schee@sap.com>
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

Closes-bug: #1679716
Change-Id: If392f41f65978721668b53cfab94393f074d24e9

commit_message:
Add test case for force detach volume

V2 volumes_client in Tempest doesn't contain volume action: force
detach volume. This patch adds the support.

Including:

[1] Add force detach volume api to v2 volumes client
[2] Add release notes
[3] Add unit test for force detach volume api
[3] Add test case: test_force_detach_volume

Change-Id: I172913b7d372225328a3c30299926c599c7d245a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/00/436400/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Add the force detach volume feature API to the v2 volumes_client library. This feature enables the possibility to force a volume to detach, and roll back an unsuccessful detach operation after you disconnect the volume.

commit_message:
Check the target host before live migrating a instance

In the live migrate form, the selections "Automatically schedule
new host." and "No other hosts available" both use an empty value,
and this input is not required, that causes I can submit the
form even there are no other hosts available.

I think the value of selection "Automatically schedule new host."
should not be empty, and this input should be required.

Change-Id: I6a88ffa23087a0d845cf8a71a6359f3f4fbddbe0
Closes-Bug: #1684604

deleted_lines: help_text=_("Choose a Host to migrate to."), required=False) host_list.insert(0, ("", _("Automatically schedule new host."))) host = None if not data['host'] else data['host']

commit_message:
Standardize test vars

Move test host vars from the inventory to individual files for each
host. 'ansible_become' has been removed from localhost's vars since it
should be handled on a playbook basis.

Change-Id: Iee0b0c4d4f6e4dc27410d47f01cacaa967deefb1

commit_message:
Skip when force_tenant_isolation=true and no admin credentials

AbsoluteLimitsTests requires force_tenant_isolation=True,
and if admin credentials are not present, the testcase will
fail instead of being skipped.

This is to let AbsoluteLimitsTests inherit from BaseVolumeAdminTest
so it can skip if admin credentials are not present.

Change-Id: Id71a705cf9b1dd0c0d41a2fb45ab77c95430a123
Closes-Bug: #1671256
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/52/444752/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(zhufl): This is in the admin directory only because it requires # force_tenant_isolation=True, but doesn't extend BaseVolumeAdminTest # because it doesn't actually use any admin credentials in the tests.

commit_message:
Optimise apt cache update task

The update of the apt cache and the package installation
can all be handled in a single task by providing the
package action plugin with the right parameters. This
removes an extra task to optimise execution.

The minimum Ansible version is raised to 2.2 due to a
known bug [1] in Ansible's apt module which does not
update the cache properly if the cache update and the
install are combined in a single task.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/1497

Change-Id: I165479e62e921adb2a46fcbdb3b7c0118b2ef739
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_server refs/changes/01/458901/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Change 'Datasources' page layout

This commit changes the datasources page layout, to avoid
loading all the data at once and showing the data in more
relevant page

Change-Id: Iaedc7be9d00060f3701b53c309738e5073450fdf
Partially-Implements: blueprint enhance-congress-dashboard
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/71/445371/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: table_classes = (datasources_tables.DataSourcesTable, datasources_tables.PoliciesTablesTable,) def get_datasources_list_data(self): logger.info("anu: datasources list is %s", datasources) return datasources except Exception as e: msg = _('Unable to get datasources list: %s') % str(e)class DatasourceView(tables.DataTableView): template_name = 'admin/datasources/datasource_detail.html' table_class = datasources_tables.DataSourcesTablesTable def get_data(self): ds_id = self.kwargs['datasource_id'] ds_temp = [] try: ds_tables = congress.datasource_tables_list(self.request, ds_id) for table in ds_tables: table.set_value('datasource_id', ds_id) table.set_id_as_name_if_empty() # Object ids within a Horizon table must be unique. Otherwise, # Horizon will cache the column values for the object by id and # use the same column values for all rows with the same id. table.set_value('table_id', table['id']) table.set_value('id', '%s-%s' % (ds_id, table['table_id'])) ds_temp.append(table) logger.debug("ds_temp %s" % ds_temp) return ds_temp except Exception as e: msg_args = {'ds_id': ds_id, 'error': str(e)} msg = _('Unable to get tables list for service "%(ds_id)s": ' '%(error)s') % msg_args messages.error(self.request, msg) return [] def get_context_data(self, **kwargs): context = super(DatasourceView, self).get_context_data(**kwargs) datasource_id = self.kwargs['datasource_id'] try: datasource = congress.datasource_get(self.request, datasource_id) status = congress.datasource_status_list(self.request, datasource['name']) context['last_updated'] = status['last_updated'] context['subscribers'] = status['subscribers'] context['subscriptions'] = status['subscriptions'] context['last_error'] = status['last_error'] context['number_of_updates'] = status['number_of_updates'] context['datasource_name'] = datasource['name'] context['status'] = ('Active' if status['initialized'] else 'Not Active') return context except Exception as e: msg_args = {'ds_id': datasource_id, 'error': str(e)} msg = _('Unable to get status for datasource "%(ds_id)s": ' '%(error)s') % msg_args messages.error(self.request, msg) return []

Otherwise, # Horizon will cache the column values for the object by id and # use the same column values for all rows with the same id. table.set_value('table_id', table['id']) table.set_value('id', '%s-%s' % (ds_id, table['table_id'])) ds_temp.append(table) logger.debug("ds_temp %s" % ds_temp) return ds_temp def get_service_status_data(self): ds = [] try: ds = congress.datasource_statuses_list(self.request) logger.debug("ds status : %s " % ds) except Exception as e: msg = _('Unable to get datasource status list: %s') % str(e) messages.error(self.request, msg) return ds

commit_message:
Standardize test vars

Move test host vars from the inventory to individual files for each
host. 'ansible_become' has been removed from localhost's vars since it
should be handled on a playbook basis. The containers' management
addresses have also been moved to the br-mgmt bridge.

Change-Id: Ib1c08d7df0d1be855ca9579faa3a2ad85b164e0d

subject: Remove pre-allocation model for OneView drivers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-10 19:17:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/7af749e96ff872244e8dce79fbfc20b82476023f', 'message': 'Deprecate pre-allocation model for OneView drivers

The OneView drivers dropped support for pre-allocation model
in Pike release, making the dynamic allocation the default
model. In this patch, we are removing the unnecessary code
that kept the support for pre-allocation.

Change-Id: I7789ffc0ebc6e42f58b184c0781fb3b122c00323
Closes-Bug: 1681509
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-10 19:58:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/69fd8a38f7cfc41f142d49c16fcbe57a606cbe08', 'message': 'Deprecate pre-allocation model for OneView drivers

The OneView drivers dropped support for pre-allocation model
in Pike release, making the dynamic allocation the default
model[0]. In this patch, we are removing the unnecessary code

commit_message:
Remove pre-allocation model for OneView drivers

The OneView drivers deprecated support for pre-allocation model
in Newton cycle (6.1.0), making the dynamic allocation the default
model[0]. This patch removes code pertaining to pre-allocation
feature from OneView drivers. The dunamic allocation feature should
be used instead.

[0] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/not-implemented/oneview-drivers-dynamic-allocation.html

Change-Id: I7789ffc0ebc6e42f58b184c0781fb3b122c00323
Closes-Bug: 1681509

commit_message:
Optimise apt cache update task

The update of the apt cache and the package installation
can all be handled in a single task by providing the
package action plugin with the right parameters. This
removes an extra task to optimise execution.

The minimum Ansible version is raised to 2.2 due to a
known bug [1] in Ansible's apt module which does not
update the cache properly if the cache update and the
install are combined in a single task.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/1497

Change-Id: If6b3261bba643759f12a811d849ce9cb1040497f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/91/458891/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Optimise apt cache update task

The update of the apt cache and the package installation
can all be handled in a single task by providing the
package action plugin with the right parameters. This
removes an extra task to optimise execution.

The minimum Ansible version is raised to 2.2 due to a
known bug [1] in Ansible's apt module which does not
update the cache properly if the cache update and the
install are combined in a single task.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/1497

Change-Id: I69970a3a76e6ac56095d0077c31f811d717d9216
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/92/458892/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: - name: Ensure apt cache is up to date apt: update_cache: yes cache_valid_time: "{{ cache_timeout }}" when: - ansible_pkg_mgr == 'apt'

subject: Eliminate lookup of "resource extend" funcs by name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-11 22:53:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0ab67266c43b5aa94fb06674ffab9a84c3c3dcc0', 'message': '[WIP] Operation Pig Bristle, part 4

Register bound functions for extending resources

By registering bound functions we cut off the dependency of the
"resource extend" functions on the plugin. This is a step towards
the goal of removing the CommonDbMixin mixin class.

Also, we register all "resource extend" functions at plugin create
(in __new__) instead of in the class definition (which caused the
hooks to be registered on import). This ensures the "resource
extend" functions are only registered for the plugins/mixins that
are actually used.

Since the "resource extend" functions are decoupled from the
plugin, we remove them from the extension mixins (make them global
in their module). This is a step towards refactoring all extension
mixins for removal.

Change-Id: I128cfda773d5f9597df9cd61261fdc05f2a174aa
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-12 01:11:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e9553b147afce857a98943230ba309171f88a6af', 'message': '[WIP] Operation Pig Bristle, part 4

'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2016-12-23 20:27:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c40ea182b381de6a85deaa7d3d2da325edc85f55', 'message': '[WIP] Operation Pig Bristle, part 4

Eliminate lookup of "resource extend" funcs by name

By registering functions directly we cut off the dependency of the
"resource extend" functions on the plugin. This is a step towards
the goal of removing the CommonDbMixin mixin class.

Also, we register all "resource extend" functions at plugin create
(in __new__) instead of in the class definition (which caused the
hooks to be registered on import). This ensures the "resource
extend" functions are only registered for the plugins/mixins that
are actually used.

Since the "resource extend" functions are decoupled from the
plugin, we remove them from the extension mixins (make them global
in their module). This is a step towards refactoring all extension
mixins for removal.

Change-Id: I128cfda773d5f9597df9cd61261fdc05f2a174aa

commit_message:
Eliminate lookup of "resource extend" funcs by name

By registering functions directly we cut off the dependency of the
"resource extend" functions on the plugin. This is a step towards
the goal of removing the CommonDbMixin mixin class.

Also, we register all "resource extend" functions at plugin create
(in __new__) instead of in the class definition (which caused the
hooks to be registered on import). This ensures the "resource
extend" functions are only registered for the plugins/mixins that
are actually used.

Note that decorators are used to register "resource extend" methods,
similar to the callback receiver decorators.

Related-Blueprint: neutron-lib

Change-Id: I128cfda773d5f9597df9cd61261fdc05f2a174aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/55/409555/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @staticmethod def _apply_dict_extend_functions(resource_type, func(response, db_object)
deleted_lines: def _apply_dict_extend_functions(self, resource_type, args = (response, db_object) if isinstance(func, six.string_types): func = getattr(self, func, None) else: # must call unbound method - use self as 1st argument args = (self,) + args if func: func(*args)

commit_message:
Fix alphanumeric comparisons for openstack and ubuntu releases

- fix up code where the alpha comparisons are done
- refactor the code so that it uses, rather than fights,
  charms.openstack features.

Change-Id: Ie3b7fdd53ee73c700b8515dce4bd114cab72269d
Related-Bug: #1659575
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-api-odl refs/changes/49/451549/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @charms_openstack.charm.register_os_release_selector def choose_charm_class(): """Choose the charm class based on the neutron-common package installed""" return ch_utils.os_release('neutron-common') class IcehouseNeutronAPIODLCharm(charms_openstack.charm.OpenStackCharm): release = 'icehouse' # Custom configure for the class service_plugins = 'router,firewall,lbaas,vpnaas,metering' service_plugins=self.service_plugins, class KiloNeutronAPIODLCharm(IcehouseNeutronAPIODLCharm): """For the kilo release we have an additional package to install: 'python-networking-odl' """ release = 'kilo' packages = ['neutron-common', 'neutron-plugin-ml2', 'python-networking-odl', ] class NewtonNeutronAPIODLCharm(KiloNeutronAPIODLCharm): """For Newton, the service_plugins on the configuration is different. """ release = 'newton' # NOTE: LBaaS v2 for >= newton service_plugins = ('router,firewall,vpnaas,metering,' 'neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.' 'plugin.LoadBalancerPluginv2')
deleted_lines: class NeutronAPIODLCharm(charms_openstack.charm.OpenStackCharm): release = 'icehouse' def __init__(self, release=None, **kwargs): """Custom initialiser for class If no release is passed, then the charm determines the release from the ch_utils.os_release() function. """ if release is None: release = ch_utils.os_release('neutron-common') super(NeutronAPIODLCharm, self).__init__(release=release, **kwargs) @property def all_packages(self): """List of packages to be installed @return ['pkg1', 'pkg2', ...] """ _packages = self.packages[:] if self.release >= 'kilo': _packages.extend(['python-networking-odl']) return _packages if self.release >= 'newton': # NOTE: LBaaS v2 for >= newton service_plugins = ( 'router,firewall,vpnaas,metering,' 'neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.' 'plugin.LoadBalancerPluginv2' ) else: service_plugins = 'router,firewall,lbaas,vpnaas,metering' service_plugins=service_plugins,

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-03 14:38:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/storlets/commit/f71ad96c77ec65f3f0314485a4b9fe146e759354', 'message': "Adding invocation magics to the IPython extension

This commit adds:
1. A dedicated documentation for the IPython extension
2. A %get command for storlet invocation on get
3. A %put command for storlet invocation on put
4. A %copy command for storlet invocation on copy

The syntax is documented in /doc/source/ipython_integration.rst

Bonus: adding __init__.py to the extension's unit test

Change-Id: Idf09aa03222586a39dfec7d132554d14f908e200

Refactor IPython extension and the tests

Mainly:

- Implements Response class instead of response dict
  (need to update the docs)

- Fix FakeConnection class from the redandunt code perspective

Need to more generarize around _call_xx in the tests...

Change-Id: Ieb46c7a696e8a4c2fe3a9cc0858ab5fef12678c6

Cleanup test_ipython code doc update and nb for test

- Abstract BaseTestIpythonExtension class for testing tools
-- And then, parse the child test classes for the methods to assert
- Remove unnecessary args and mock patches
- Avoid redandunt code duplication

Update the docs with the Response

Adding a notebook for testing the ipython extension

Change-Id: I0842fae5f20268cdd8ccf284eecab77498074e83

The syntax is documented in /doc/source/ipython_integration.rst

Bonus: adding __init__.py to the extension's unit test

Change-Id: Idf09aa03222586a39dfec7d132554d14f908e200

Refactor IPython extension and the tests

Mainly:

- Implements Response class instead of response dict
  (need to update the docs)

- Fix FakeConnection class from the redandunt code perspective

Need to more generarize around _call_xx in the tests...

Change-Id: Ieb46c7a696e8a4c2fe3a9cc0858ab5fef12678c6

Cleanup test_ipython code doc update and nb for test

- Abstract BaseTestIpythonExtension class for testing tools
-- And then, parse the child test classes for the methods to assert
- Remove unnecessary args and mock patches
- Avoid redandunt code duplication

Update the docs with the Response

commit_message:
Adding invocation magics to the IPython extension

This commit adds:
1. A dedicated documentation for the IPython extension
2. A %get command for storlet invocation on get
3. A %put command for storlet invocation on put
4. A %copy command for storlet invocation on copy

The syntax is documented in /doc/source/ipython_integration.rst

Bonus: adding __init__.py to the extension's unit test

Change-Id: Idf09aa03222586a39dfec7d132554d14f908e200

Refactor IPython extension and the tests

Mainly:

- Implements Response class instead of response dict
  (need to update the docs)

- Fix FakeConnection class from the redandunt code perspective

Need to more generarize around _call_xx in the tests...

Change-Id: Ieb46c7a696e8a4c2fe3a9cc0858ab5fef12678c6

Cleanup test_ipython code doc update and nb for test

- Abstract BaseTestIpythonExtension class for testing tools
-- And then, parse the child test classes for the methods to assert
- Remove unnecessary args and mock patches
- Avoid redandunt code duplication

Update the docs with the Response

Adding a notebook for testing the ipython extension
plus automated testing of that notebook

Change-Id: I0842fae5f20268cdd8ccf284eecab77498074e83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/49/452649/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class MockShell(object): def __init__(self): self.user_ns = {} def register(self, var_name, value): # perhaps, we don't need this method because caller can set the # value directly. However, this method could be worth to know # what variable is in the shell env explicitly self.user_ns[var_name] = value class BaseTestIpythonExtension(object): def setUp(self): self.magics.shell = MockShell() @mock.patch('storlets.tools.extensions.ipython.Connection') def _call_cell(self, func, line, cell, fake_conn): fake_conn.return_value = self.fake_connection # cell magic func(line, cell) @mock.patch('storlets.tools.extensions.ipython.Connection') def _call_line(self, func, line, fake_conn): fake_conn.return_value = self.fake_connection # line magic func(line) class TestStorletMagicStorletApp(BaseTestIpythonExtension, unittest.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestStorletMagicStorletApp, self).setUp() self.fake_connection = FakeConnection() def _call_storletapp(self, line, cell): self._call_cell(self.magics.storletapp, line, cell) class TestStorletMagicGet(BaseTestIpythonExtension, unittest.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestStorletMagicGet, self).setUp() self.fake_connection = FakeConnection() def _call_get(self, line): self._call_line(self.magics.get, line) def test_get_invalid_args(self): def _test_get(self, line, outvar_name): self._call_get(line) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) def test_get(self): self._test_get(line, outvar_name) def test_get_with_input(self): # commit_message:
Add reweight_osd method for changing OSD weights

This adds a method which simply performs a ceph osd crush reweight to
the new value.  To be used with charm actions such as one to gradually
increase/decrease weights.

Change-Id: Ia4af9abd6729fc075d535d2bb9385951b95425e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charms.ceph refs/changes/20/458320/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def reweight_osd(osd_num, new_weight): """ Changes the crush weight of an OSD to the value specified. :param osd_num: the osd id which should be changed :param new_weight: the new weight for the OSD :returns: bool. True if output looks right, else false. :raises CalledProcessError: if an error occurs invoking the systemd cmd """ try: cmd_result = check_output(['ceph', 'osd', 'crush', 'reweight', "osd.{}".format(osd_num), new_weight]) expected_result = ('reweighted item id {ID} name \'osd.{ID}\' to ', '{WEIGHT}').format(ID=osd_num, WEIGHT=new_weight) if expected_result in cmd_result: return True return False except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: log("ceph osd tree command failed with message: {}".format( e.message)) raise

commit_message:
Add get_ceph_health

This adds a generic method for use with actions where we want to ensure the
cluster is healthy before making changes such as osd weights.

Change-Id: I5ea8f44051c915cb713fcd731744e039e94fb90f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charms.ceph refs/changes/12/458312/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_ceph_health(): """ Returns the health of the cluster from a 'ceph health' :return: dict Also raises CalledProcessError if our ceph command fails To get the overall status, use get_ceph_health()['overall_status'] """ try: tree = check_output( ['ceph', 'health', '--format=json']) try: json_tree = json.loads(tree) # Make sure children are present in the json if not json_tree['overall_status']: return None return json_tree except ValueError as v: log("Unable to parse ceph tree json: {}. Error: {}".format( tree, v.message)) raise except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: log("ceph osd tree command failed with message: {}".format( e.message)) raise

The infra team recently changed how the rules are applied.
Unfortunately the new configuration seems broken and failing to set up

and thus failing.  For now, workaround the issue by ignoring

Change-Id: I7b13fdb97f8175248bf5cb44c7b2e103ae3a39c0

commit_message:
Workaround iptables issue in VM images for gate

The infra team recently changed how the rules are applied.
Unfortunately the new configuration seems broken and failing to set up
any chains.  Our gate scripts assume the existance of those chains,
and thus failing.  For now, workaround the issue by ignoring
failures of iptables command in those scripts.

Related-Bug: #1686271
Change-Id: I7b13fdb97f8175248bf5cb44c7b2e103ae3a39c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/38/459938/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix test_execute_basic_action_plan failure

If get_node_by_uuid() raise ComputeNodeNotFound,
it should add node to datemodel before return.

Change-Id: Ic9eccb10612abc8cea45bc4cbde09631bfc3caf5
Closes-Bug: #1686281

commit_message:
remove duplicated bum flow for provider app

In current code, the BUM flow from l2 look up jump to egress
table has been installed in l2 app, but the provider app still
add the same flow in l2 look up table, it's useless.

Change-Id: I0bdb184ca1efc8ea020da62f31a885ffd3228669
Closes-bug: #1685432

commit_message:
Replace uuid.uuid4() with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids. We should
use that function to generate uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: I90d14bb1ca216740ccd729d0e15b8f4fe55f9ccb
Closes-Bug: #1082248

commit_message:
Add additional volume status for reset and force-delete tests

With the development of Cinder, the valid status of volume for
reset and force-delete is growing. This patch adds additional
status for these two tests.

Change-Id: Ib3894ea285381f55a583e3799dc00b14455a9d28
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/97/456997/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import random # Note(jeremyZ): The valid status for resetting volume status. # It may be expanded or changed with the development of Cinder. valid_status = ['creating', 'available', 'deleting', 'error', 'error_deleting', 'attaching', 'in-use', 'detaching', 'maintenance'] random.shuffle(valid_status) for status in valid_status: @decorators.idempotent_id('19c05511-3189-40a9-aee4-e54c6a606dc6') def test_volume_force_delete_when_volume_is_creating(self): # test force delete when status of volume is detaching self._create_reset_and_force_delete_temp_volume('detaching') @decorators.idempotent_id('a50d05fc-64c8-424d-bf14-72acb9246ef4') def test_volume_force_delete_when_volume_is_creating(self): # test force delete when status of volume is error_deleting self._create_reset_and_force_delete_temp_volume('error_deleting') @decorators.idempotent_id('9972890d-b7c9-41dc-a605-6114a1570c4e') def test_volume_force_delete_when_volume_is_creating(self): # test force delete when status of volume is in-use self._create_reset_and_force_delete_temp_volume('in-use') @decorators.idempotent_id('8165da9a-db3f-48e7-b2e0-6a22979246ee') def test_volume_force_delete_when_volume_is_creating(self): # test force delete when status of volume is available self._create_reset_and_force_delete_temp_volume('available') @decorators.idempotent_id('a0b8b884-f1d0-4cce-ab85-11f89ac8e13d') def test_volume_force_delete_when_volume_is_creating(self): # test force delete when status of volume is deleting self._create_reset_and_force_delete_temp_volume('deleting')
deleted_lines: # test volume reset status : available->error->available for status in ['error', 'available', 'maintenance']:

commit_message:
Update .mailmap

This commit updates .mailmap. This file is useful when we use
`git-shortlog` to get a single author when who uses multiple email
addresses (like me). So, it's better to update the file and keep it
latest as possible.

Change-Id: I530de0b23ff317f817b49e01d51757813a623572

commit_message:
Remove skip condition when resize is enable

This commit removes the skip condition with flavor_ref and
flavor_ref_alt when the resize feature is enable. Because when
resize feature is enable, the flavor_ref and flavor_ref_alt should be
set properly, otherwise, it is a misconfiguration. So we should fail
but not skip at the situation.

And This commit also add a help message for the resize config to avoid
users confusing.

Change-Id: I8eab2e57eb77e7a1a8dae7ffd63ec95ae6a026c3

commit_message:
Remove translation of log messages from ironic/drivers/modules/ucs

i18n team has decided not to translate the logs because it seems
like it's not very useful. Removed translation of log messages
from ironic/drivers/modules/ucs

Change-Id: I68cb6f1b91588d4facd8ffed3fc9612e13f529a2
Partial-Bug: #1674374

commit_message:
Remove subunit-trace fork

This makes tox use the latest version of the tool from os-testr repo,
which contains some valuable changes, like the one making the gate fail
if for some reason no tests are executed because all of them are
skipped.

Change-Id: If88be4b310d746ccc885e3d0c1db8a4dfabb2a28

added_lines: The mistral client is the command-line interface (CLI) for the Workflow service (mistral) API and its extensions. This chapter documents :command:`mistral` version ``3.1.0``. [--os-tenant-id TENANT_ID] [--os-project-id PROJECT_ID] [--os-tenant-name TENANT_NAME] [--os-project-name PROJECT_NAME] OS_TENANT_ID or OS_PROJECT_ID) ``--os-project-id PROJECT_ID`` Authentication project identifier (Env: OS_TENANT_ID or OS_PROJECT_ID), will use tenant_id if both tenant_id and project_id are set OS_TENANT_NAME or OS_PROJECT_NAME) ``--os-project-name PROJECT_NAME`` Authentication project name (Env: OS_TENANT_NAME or OS_PROJECT_NAME), will use tenant_name if both tenant_name and project_name are set keystone, keycloak-oidc. commit_message:
Use Sphinx 1.5 warning-is-error

With pbr 2.0 and Sphinx 1.5, the setting for treat sphinx warnings as
errors is setting warning-is-error in build_sphinx section. We should
enable this by default to prevent suprise for users.

Change-Id: I090a62d4460d83ce24ed60ebcfa224670282ee2b

commit_message:
Add test cases for volume quota class

Now tempest has provided tests for tenant's quota in volume, but
lacks tests for volume quota class. This patch adds this support.

Including:

[1] Add volume v2 quota class client as library
[2] Add release note
[3] Add test cases: show & update volume 'default' quota class
[4] Add unit tests for volume v2 quota class client
[5] Fix for test_volume_quotas.py

Change-Id: I30bac79b986e6e90d43dcc6f9d247e74a314bf3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/92/454992/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2017 FiberHome Telecommunication Technologies CO.,LTD # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_serialization import jsonutils as json from tempest.lib.common import rest_client class QuotaClassesClient(rest_client.RestClient): """Volume quota class V2 client.""" api_version = "v2" def show_quota_class_set(self, quota_class_name): """List quotas for a quota class. TODO: Current api-site doesn't contain this API description. After fixing the api-site, we need to fix here also for putting the link to api-site. """ url = 'os-quota-class-sets/%s' % quota_class_name resp, body = self.get(url) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def update_quota_class_set(self, quota_class_name, **kwargs): """Update quotas for a quota class. TODO: Current api-site doesn't contain this API description. After fixing the api-site, we need to fix here also for putting the link to api-site. """ url = 'os-quota-class-sets/%s' % quota_class_name put_body = json.dumps({'quota_class_set': kwargs}) resp, body = self.put(url, put_body) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/33/457933/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - A new ``openstacksdk`` client plugin to use python-openstacksdk library and a ``neutron.segment`` custom constraint. - A new ``OS::Neutron:Segment`` resource to create routed networks. Availability of this resource depends on availability of neutron ``segment`` API extension. - Resource ``OS::neutron::Subnet`` now supports ``segment`` optional property to specify a segment. - Resource ``OS::neutron::Net`` now supports ``l2_adjacency`` atribute on whether L2 connectivity is available across the network or not.

subject: Don't create /etc/iptables/rules
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-26 04:21:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/88489c2e00e430a4eda22b97c4b0e097a84d6f90', 'message': "Fix symlink for iptables rules

Make sure we create our symlinks for iptables rules the same way
puppet-iptables does. Otherwise, we'll have 2 symlinks, linking to
each other.

Change-Id: I7e65793ba7513ac54ae701cc29c7c5ff6e33410d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-26 04:31:59.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/nodepool-base/install.d/20-iptables'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/1ae69b1f8c8b6f5a3b0dc22302ad6157b825c456', 'message': "Don't create /etc/iptables/rules

puppet-iptables was creating /etc/iptables/rules and linking it to
rules.v4.  We have removed this with
I03db58441674a3f3eea86165c949a7d14425a0b7 so this can simply make
rules.v4 and rules.v6 files, as required by
[netfilter|iptables]-persistent

Change-Id: I7e65793ba7513ac54ae701cc29c7c5ff6e33410d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Don't create /etc/iptables/rules

puppet-iptables was creating /etc/iptables/rules and linking it to
rules.v4.  We have removed this with
I03db58441674a3f3eea86165c949a7d14425a0b7 so this can simply make
rules.v4 and rules.v6 files, as required by
[netfilter|iptables]-persistent

Change-Id: I7e65793ba7513ac54ae701cc29c7c5ff6e33410d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/39/459939/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cat > $ipv4_rules/rules << EOFln -s ${ipv4_rules}/rules ${rules_dir}

commit_message:
Fix alphanumeric comparisons for openstack and ubuntu releases

- sync charmhelpers with fix-alpha helpers
- fix up code where the alpha comparisons are done
- fix tests which assumed mocks would just work on os_release()

Change-Id: I3d1a8993286f0e7a1037c03e6711015883f1b615
Related-Bug: #1659575

deleted_lines: <LimitExcept {{ allowed_http_methods }} > Order Allow,Deny Deny from all

subject: Use plain routes list for '/os-keypairs' endpoint instead of stevedore
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-13 07:49:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2aa27591e2918f296c933040049f4bd7d974934f', 'message': "Use plain routes list for '/os-keypairs' endpoint instead of stevedore

This patch adds '/os-keypairs' related routes by a plain list, instead
of using stevedore. After all the Nova API endpoints moves to
the plain routes list, the usage of stevedore for API loading will be
removed from Nova.

Also note that the original 'ProjectMapper' use the 'routes.Mapper.resource'
to create a set of routes for a resource which comform to the Atom
publishing protocol. It includes some of URL mappings we didn't document
before. This patch will remove those URL mappings. For the detail,
please reference:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/114736.html

Change-Id: I9b18e7acce37ba935f4302cc89c3aeccc4f50915

commit_message:
Use plain routes list for '/os-keypairs' endpoint instead of stevedore

This patch adds '/os-keypairs' related routes by a plain list, instead
of using stevedore. After all the Nova API endpoints moves to
the plain routes list, the usage of stevedore for API loading will be
removed from Nova.

Also note that the original 'ProjectMapper' use the 'routes.Mapper.resource'
to create a set of routes for a resource which comform to the Atom
publishing protocol. It includes some of URL mappings we didn't document
before. This patch will remove those URL mappings. For the detail,
please reference:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/114736.html

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike
Change-Id: I9b18e7acce37ba935f4302cc89c3aeccc4f50915
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/78/456478/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
2.45: Remove Location header from createImage and createBackup responses

This changes the response for the createImage and createBackup
server action APIs to no longer return a Location header and instead
returns a json dict body with the snapshot image ID. This is done
in a new microversion.

Implements blueprint remove-create-image-location-header-response

Closes-Bug: #1679285

Change-Id: Idc899ee76b8265b1c9e0871b6c7c277424cdd442

commit_message:
Fix mech_driver not found

mech_driver is not defined in port status notifier, and it will report
error when try to report status of port.

Change-Id: Id9645ef7167f5a827cb035f2057d7b24a30dfbad
Closes-Bug: #1682013

deleted_lines: from dragonflow.common import constants LOG.info("Process port %s status update event", str(key)) if constants.PORT_STATUS_UP == value: self.mech_driver.set_port_status_up(key) if constants.PORT_STATUS_DOWN == value: self.mech_driver.set_port_status_down(key)

commit_message:
Fix EC2 related buttons url in the api access page

access_and_security has moved to separate panel since
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/reorganise-access-and-security,
but Download/Recreate EC2 Credentials url were not updated.

Change-Id: Ie16aabb7c272ef871138c59737e694966d7f5168
Closes-Bug: #1686088
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/90/459690/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: url = "horizon:project:api_access:ec2" url = "horizon:project:api_access:recreate_credentials"

subject: Support multi-gateway NS networking with EW enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-07 08:34:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/60b31607331c075d62d504e1733a4c2340cecbde', 'message': 'Support multi-gateway NS networking with EW enabled

1. What is the problem?
As discussed in the spec[1], we lack support of one deployment
scenario that each OpenStack cloud provides external network
for north-south traffic and at the same time east-west networking

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Implement a new layer-3 networking model discussed in the spec[1].

to realize the solution?
Xmanager is modified to properly configure router interface, router
extra routes and subnet host routes for the new model.

commit_message:
Support multi-gateway NS networking with EW enabled

1. What is the problem?
As discussed in the spec[1], we lack support of one deployment
scenario that each OpenStack cloud provides external network
for north-south traffic and at the same time east-west networking
of tenant networks between OpenStack clouds are also enabled.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Implement a new layer-3 networking model discussed in the spec[1].

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
Xmanager is modified to properly configure router interface, router
extra routes and subnet host routes for the new model.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tricircle/blob/master/specs/pike/
    l3-networking-multi-NS-with-EW-enabled.rst

Change-Id: I34ad7dbf01be68f4544b2170b2cfe90097c4edf5

commit_message:
New command "overcloud container image build"

This command receives the same --config-file argument as "overcloud
container image upload" and invokes kolla-build to build the images
specified in that file.

It is also possible to specify --kolla-config-file multiple times to
control the behaviour of kolla-build.

Change-Id: If06a941eaf8d92c29ed84387c4f040866cf07cfa
Depends-On: I061f626fdb3d71613aa23436bf6c53cf4de62213

commit_message:
Revise text about py34

Zaqar has already dropped py34[1], so the text "py34" and
"Runs the Python unit tests with a Python 3.4 environment."
need to be deleted. Besides, we should support py35.
[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/418170/

Closes-Bug: #1686038

commit_message:
Add a fullstack test protecting a server which boots from a volume

The server could boot from a image. It also could boot from a bootable
volume. This patch add a fullstack test about this use case.

Change-Id: If12443bb05b99e631406800e250e0804710a6e54
Closes-Bug: #1681879
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/88/456188/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_server_boot_from_volume_with_attached_volume(self): """Test checkpoint for server with a bootable volume Test checkpoint for server which has booted form one bootable volume. """ bootable_volume = self.store(objects.Volume()) bootable_volume_id = bootable_volume.create(1, create_from_image=True) volume = self.store(objects.Volume()) volume.create(1) server = self.store(objects.Server()) server.create(volume=bootable_volume_id) server.attach_volume(volume.id) plan = self.store(objects.Plan()) plan.create(self.provider_id, [server, ]) checkpoint = self.store(objects.Checkpoint()) checkpoint.create(self.provider_id, plan.id, timeout=2400) items = self.karbor_client.checkpoints.list(self.provider_id) ids = [item.id for item in items] self.assertTrue(checkpoint.id in ids) search_opts = {"volume_id": volume.id} backups = self.cinder_client.backups.list(search_opts=search_opts) self.assertEqual(1, len(backups)) search_opts = {"volume_id": bootable_volume_id} bootable_backups = self.cinder_client.backups.list( search_opts=search_opts) self.assertEqual(1, len(bootable_backups)) server.detach_volume(volume.id)
